00026 #ifndef _JAVASOFT_JAWT_H_
00027 #define _JAVASOFT_JAWT_H_

00029 #include "jni.h"

00031 #ifdef __cplusplus
00032 extern "C" {

00035 /*
00036  * AWT native interface (new in JDK 1.3)
00037  *
00038  * The AWT native interface allows a native C or C++ application a means
00039  * by which to access native structures in AWT.  This is to facilitate moving
00040  * legacy C and C++ applications to Java and to target the needs of the
00041  * community who, at present, wish to do their own native rendering to canvases
00042  * for performance reasons.  Standard extensions such as Java3D also require a
00043  * means to access the underlying native data structures of AWT.
00044  *
00045  * There may be future extensions to this API depending on demand.
00046  *
00047  * A VM does not have to implement this API in order to pass the JCK.
00048  * It is recommended, however, that this API is implemented on VMs that support
00049  * standard extensions, such as Java3D.
00050  *
00051  * Since this is a native API, any program which uses it cannot be considered
00052  * 100% pure java.
00053  */
00054 
00055 /*
00056  * AWT Native Drawing Surface (JAWT_DrawingSurface).
00057  *
00058  * For each platform, there is a native drawing surface structure.  This
00059  * platform-specific structure can be found in jawt_md.h.  It is recommended
00060  * that additional platforms follow the same model.  It is also recommended
00061  * that VMs on Win32 and Solaris support the existing structures in jawt_md.h.
00062  *
00063  *******************
00064  * EXAMPLE OF USAGE:
00065  *******************
00066  *
00067  * In Win32, a programmer wishes to access the HWND of a canvas to perform
00068  * native rendering into it.  The programmer has declared the paint() method
00069  * for their canvas subclass to be native:
00070  *
00071  *
00072  * MyCanvas.java:
00073  *
00074  * import java.awt.*;
00075  *
00076  * public class MyCanvas extends Canvas {
00077  *
00078  *     static {
00079  *         System.loadLibrary("mylib");
00080  *     }
00081  *
00082  *     public native void paint(Graphics g);
00083  * }
00084  *
00085  *
00086  * myfile.c:
00087  *
00088  * #include "jawt_md.h"
00089  * #include <assert.h>
00090  *
00091  * JNIEXPORT void JNICALL
00092  * Java_MyCanvas_paint(JNIEnv* env, jobject canvas, jobject graphics)
00093  * {
00094  *     JAWT awt;
00095  *     JAWT_DrawingSurface* ds;
00096  *     JAWT_DrawingSurfaceInfo* dsi;
00097  *     JAWT_Win32DrawingSurfaceInfo* dsi_win;
00098  *     jboolean result;
00099  *     jint lock;
00100  *
00101  *     // Get the AWT
00102  *     awt.version = JAWT_VERSION_1_3;
00103  *     result = JAWT_GetAWT(env, &awt);
00104  *     assert(result != JNI_FALSE);
00105  *
00106  *     // Get the drawing surface
00107  *     ds = awt.GetDrawingSurface(env, canvas);
00108  *     assert(ds != NULL);
00109  *
00110  *     // Lock the drawing surface
00111  *     lock = ds->Lock(ds);
00112  *     assert((lock & JAWT_LOCK_ERROR) == 0);
00113  *
00114  *     // Get the drawing surface info
00115  *     dsi = ds->GetDrawingSurfaceInfo(ds);
00116  *
00117  *     // Get the platform-specific drawing info
00118  *     dsi_win = (JAWT_Win32DrawingSurfaceInfo*)dsi->platformInfo;
00119  *
00120  *     //////////////////////////////
00121  *     // !!! DO PAINTING HERE !!! //
00122  *     //////////////////////////////
00123  *
00124  *     // Free the drawing surface info
00125  *     ds->FreeDrawingSurfaceInfo(dsi);
00126  *
00127  *     // Unlock the drawing surface
00128  *     ds->Unlock(ds);
00129  *
00130  *     // Free the drawing surface
00131  *     awt.FreeDrawingSurface(ds);
00132  * }
00133  *
00134  */
00135 
00136 /*
00137  * JAWT_Rectangle
00138  * Structure for a native rectangle.
00139  */
00140 typedef struct jawt_Rectangle {
00141     jint x;
00142     jint y;
00143     jint width;
00144     jint height;
00145 } JAWT_Rectangle;
00146 
00147 struct jawt_DrawingSurface;
00148 
00149 /*
00150  * JAWT_DrawingSurfaceInfo
00151  * Structure for containing the underlying drawing information of a component.
00152  */
00153 typedef struct jawt_DrawingSurfaceInfo {
00154     /*
00155      * Pointer to the platform-specific information.  This can be safely
00156      * cast to a JAWT_Win32DrawingSurfaceInfo on Windows or a
00157      * JAWT_X11DrawingSurfaceInfo on Solaris. On Mac OS X this is a
00158      * pointer to a NSObject that conforms to the JAWT_SurfaceLayers
00159      * protocol. See jawt_md.h for details.
00160      */
00161     void* platformInfo;
00162     /* Cached pointer to the underlying drawing surface */
00163     struct jawt_DrawingSurface* ds;
00164     /* Bounding rectangle of the drawing surface */
00165     JAWT_Rectangle bounds;
00166     /* Number of rectangles in the clip */
00167     jint clipSize;
00168     /* Clip rectangle array */
00169     JAWT_Rectangle* clip;
00170 } JAWT_DrawingSurfaceInfo;
00171 
00172 #define JAWT_LOCK_ERROR                 0x00000001
00173 #define JAWT_LOCK_CLIP_CHANGED          0x00000002
00174 #define JAWT_LOCK_BOUNDS_CHANGED        0x00000004
00175 #define JAWT_LOCK_SURFACE_CHANGED       0x00000008
00176 
00177 /*
00178  * JAWT_DrawingSurface
00179  * Structure for containing the underlying drawing information of a component.
00180  * All operations on a JAWT_DrawingSurface MUST be performed from the same
00181  * thread as the call to GetDrawingSurface.
00182  */
00183 typedef struct jawt_DrawingSurface {
00184     /*
00185      * Cached reference to the Java environment of the calling thread.
00186      * If Lock(), Unlock(), GetDrawingSurfaceInfo() or
00187      * FreeDrawingSurfaceInfo() are called from a different thread,
00188      * this data member should be set before calling those functions.
00189      */
00190     JNIEnv* env;
00191     /* Cached reference to the target object */
00192     jobject target;
00193     /*
00194      * Lock the surface of the target component for native rendering.
00195      * When finished drawing, the surface must be unlocked with
00196      * Unlock().  This function returns a bitmask with one or more of the
00197      * following values:
00198      *
00199      * JAWT_LOCK_ERROR - When an error has occurred and the surface could not
00200      * be locked.
00201      *
00202      * JAWT_LOCK_CLIP_CHANGED - When the clip region has changed.
00203      *
00204      * JAWT_LOCK_BOUNDS_CHANGED - When the bounds of the surface have changed.
00205      *
00206      * JAWT_LOCK_SURFACE_CHANGED - When the surface itself has changed
00207      */
00208     jint (JNICALL *Lock)
00209         (struct jawt_DrawingSurface* ds);
00210     /*
00211      * Get the drawing surface info.
00212      * The value returned may be cached, but the values may change if
00213      * additional calls to Lock() or Unlock() are made.
00214      * Lock() must be called before this can return a valid value.
00215      * Returns NULL if an error has occurred.
00216      * When finished with the returned value, FreeDrawingSurfaceInfo must be
00217      * called.
00218      */
00219     JAWT_DrawingSurfaceInfo* (JNICALL *GetDrawingSurfaceInfo)
00220         (struct jawt_DrawingSurface* ds);
00221     /*
00222      * Free the drawing surface info.
00223      */
00224     void (JNICALL *FreeDrawingSurfaceInfo)
00225         (JAWT_DrawingSurfaceInfo* dsi);
00226     /*
00227      * Unlock the drawing surface of the target component for native rendering.
00228      */
00229     void (JNICALL *Unlock)
00230         (struct jawt_DrawingSurface* ds);
00231 } JAWT_DrawingSurface;
00232 
00233 /*
00234  * JAWT
00235  * Structure for containing native AWT functions.
00236  */
00237 typedef struct jawt {
00238     /*
00239      * Version of this structure.  This must always be set before
00240      * calling JAWT_GetAWT()
00241      */
00242     jint version;
00243     /*
00244      * Return a drawing surface from a target jobject.  This value
00245      * may be cached.
00246      * Returns NULL if an error has occurred.
00247      * Target must be a java.awt.Component (should be a Canvas
00248      * or Window for native rendering).
00249      * FreeDrawingSurface() must be called when finished with the
00250      * returned JAWT_DrawingSurface.
00251      */
00252     JAWT_DrawingSurface* (JNICALL *GetDrawingSurface)
00253         (JNIEnv* env, jobject target);
00254     /*
00255      * Free the drawing surface allocated in GetDrawingSurface.
00256      */
00257     void (JNICALL *FreeDrawingSurface)
00258         (JAWT_DrawingSurface* ds);
00259     /*
00260      * Since 1.4
00261      * Locks the entire AWT for synchronization purposes
00262      */
00263     void (JNICALL *Lock)(JNIEnv* env);
00264     /*
00265      * Since 1.4
00266      * Unlocks the entire AWT for synchronization purposes
00267      */
00268     void (JNICALL *Unlock)(JNIEnv* env);
00269     /*
00270      * Since 1.4
00271      * Returns a reference to a java.awt.Component from a native
00272      * platform handle.  On Windows, this corresponds to an HWND;
00273      * on Solaris and Linux, this is a Drawable.  For other platforms,
00274      * see the appropriate machine-dependent header file for a description.
00275      * The reference returned by this function is a local
00276      * reference that is only valid in this environment.
00277      * This function returns a NULL reference if no component could be
00278      * found with matching platform information.
00279      */
00280     jobject (JNICALL *GetComponent)(JNIEnv* env, void* platformInfo);
00281 
00282 } JAWT;
00283 
00284 /*
00285  * Get the AWT native structure.  This function returns JNI_FALSE if
00286  * an error occurs.
00287  */
00288 _JNI_IMPORT_OR_EXPORT_
00289 jboolean JNICALL JAWT_GetAWT(JNIEnv* env, JAWT* awt);

00292 #define JAWT_VERSION_1_4 0x00010004
00293 #define JAWT_VERSION_1_7 0x00010007
